content: sl1 k1 psso k3 k2tog p7 sl1 k1 psso k3 k2tog 5 times p11 89 sts row 78 yo k11 p5 k7 5 times p5 k13 90 sts row 79 yo p13 sl1 k1 psso k1 k2tog p7 sl1 k1 psso k1 k2tog 5 times p12 79 sts row 80 yo k12 p3 k7 5 times p3 k14 80 sts row 81 p14 k3tog p7 k3tog 5 times p13 68 sts row 82 yo k69 70 sts row 83 yo k70 71 sts row 84 yo p71 72 sts row 85 yo k72 73 sts row 86 yo p73 74 sts cast off all stitches for the oak leaf lace edging cast on 10 stitches in main colour knit 10 stitches repeat chart c/row 1-10 approximately 165 times checking against the body of the blanket for length and cast off use cc1 cc2 and cc3 for random repeats as desired or you can follow the color schematic of the sample which gives the number of repeats of each color in order follow chart c or the written instructions below row 1 rs sl k1 yo k2tog k1 yo twice k2tog × 2 k1 12 sts row 2 ws sl wyif k2 p1 × 3 k2 row 3 sl k1 yo k2tog k3 yo twice k2tog × 2 k1 14 sts row 4 sl wyif k2 p1 × 2 k4 p1 k2 row 5 sl k1 yo k2tog k5 yo twice k2tog × 2 k1 16 sts row 6 sl wyif k2 p1 × 2 k6 p1 k2 row 7 sl k1 yo k2tog k7 yo twice k2tog × 2 k1 18 sts row 8 sl wyif k2 p1 × 2 k8 p1 k2 row 9 sl k1 yo k2tog k14 row 10 bind off × 8 k7 p1 k2 10 sts finishing whip stitch four triangles into a square stitching through the corresponding yarnovers along the edges pull a thread around the centre where the four leaves join to tighten and close any hole once the square is sewn block the squares are sewn together using mattress stitch once the squares are sewn the quilt can again be blocked if desired or seams simply steamed the edging is sewn on using whip stitch eased around the corners to avoid puckering all ends to be sewn in about the designer rebecca-anne c do rozario is a fairy-tale scholar writer metalsmith farmer and sometimes knitwear designer her patterns can be seen on ravelry https //www ravelry com/designers/rebecca-anne-c-do-rozario email rcdorozario@gmail com
